events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at an intersection involving their vehicle and requested to file a claim immediately.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of two cars in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the case and assist the claimant through the process.
The insurer formally acknowledged the receipt of the claim and assured that the investigation will begin soon.
The claimant was asked to submit accident reports, photos of the damaged vehicle, and any relevant police documentation.
All requested documents including photos and police reports were submitted by the claimant within the given deadline.
Investigation commenced to assess the damage to the vehicle and verify the details reported by the claimant.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of liability and a comprehensive damage report prepared by the assessor.
A settlement amount was proposed based on the damage assessment and the terms of the insurance policy.
The claimant provided feedback on the proposed settlement and expressed some concerns about the repair timelines.
Following review of the feedback, the claim was approved without changes and the customer was notified promptly.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the claimant to cover the costs of vehicle repairs.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation from the claimant that the repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All case documents and correspondence were archived in the system for future reference and auditing purposes.
